title: How to find an artist for my indie label - Quora

response.answer_text: It can depend on what resources you have available to you but mainly is going to involve physically listening to quite a bit of new music and analyzing data. Are you looking to work with mainly artists in and around your community or are you looking for artists across the globe? These days we have information available to us like never before. You can seek out trending artists on youtube or soundcloud. Find someone you can get behind. Go to smaller shows where artists may have booked their own spot (100-250 cap club venues). The type if artist you sign will also greatly depend on what YOU can offer THEM. What’s your reach in the industry? How much are you able or willing to invest in an artist (time and money)? Answers to many of these questions will point you in the right direction. If you have a lot of capital, your options open up quite a bit.

How do I find an artist for my indie label? Use every social media medium.. After you’ve identified artists you like, then start to understand if they’re worth your time. Do they have a solid fan base?Where are they performing?How often are they performing?How many albums do they have?Do they have a strong online presence?Are they investing in any marketing?You will be able to tell these things without actually speaking with them.. if they pass this test, then it may warrant a conversation depending on what you’re looking for.
